medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden onset of thoracic pain related to deep in- and exhalation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced a sudden onset of symptoms after 11 months post-implantation of the ICD, initially treated for suspected pleuritis and musculoskeletal pain with ibuprofen for one week before presenting to the hospital. Symptoms progressed in severity, leading to the discovery of a large pericardial effusion and perforation of the ICD lead.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary artery disease, impaired left ventricular ejection fraction of 24%, persistent atrial fibrillation.
medical_history.social_history: Active lifestyle, involved in cycling and golfing; taking warfarin.
